title: Analysis Of Obama's Remarks On Iraq
teaser: The president says he's sending up to 300 military advisers to Iraq. Foreign Affairs editor Gideon Rose discusses his remarks.
contentencoded:
President Obama said that he is sending up to 300 military advisers to Iraq and will work more closely with the Iraqi government to battle militants who have been rapidly advancing toward Baghdad from the country’s north.

The president also emphasized that no combat troops will be sent to fight in Iraq. He said the crisis there has to be solved by Iraqis.

Gideon Rose, editor of Foreign Affairs, discusses the president’s remarks with Here & Now’s Jeremy Hobson.

Guest

  • Gideon Rose, editor of Foreign Affairs magazine and a member of the Council on Foreign Relations.
